page.title: 08A Head Gamekeeper
page.content: The Head Gamekeeper on the Normanby Park Estate is responsible for the gamebirds,such as partridges and pheasants,on the Estate's 6000 acres. The present keeper has been doing this job for 27 years.When he first started there were three other keepers where as now there is one but motor vehicles are now used instead of the foot patrols of 30 years ago.To ensure an adequate number of birds eggs are hatched in incubators and the chicks reared in pens until they are old enough to be released into the wild.Thereafter the keepers protect them as well as possible from vermin and predators such as stoats,weasels, ferrets,foxes and poachers.Poachers are a nuisance and the keeper has to be on the alert.He has a close working relationship with the police and can contact them by radio telephone.
